metadata.title: CVE-2017-5522 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Stack-based buffer overflow in MapServer before 6.0.6, 6.2.x before 6.2.4,6.4.x before 6.4.5, and 7.0.x before 7.0.4 allows remote attackers to causea denial of service (crash) or execute arbitrary code via vectors involvingWFS get feature requests.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5522` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cgi-mapserver - 6.4.1-2ubuntu0.1
libmapscript-perl - 6.4.1-2ubuntu0.1
libmapscript-ruby - 6.4.1-2ubuntu0.1
libmapscript-ruby1.8 - 6.4.1-2ubuntu0.1
libmapscript-ruby1.9.1 - 6.4.1-2ubuntu0.1
libmapserver1 - 6.4.1-2ubuntu0.1
mapserver-bin - 6.4.1-2ubuntu0.1
php5-mapscript - 6.4.1-2ubuntu0.1
python-mapscript - 6.4.1-2ubuntu0.1
ruby-mapscript - 6.4.1-2ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mapserver package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.4.1-2ubuntu0.1').
